metadata.Title: CVE-2018-7453 on Ubuntu 16.04 ESM (xenial) - negligible
metadata.Description:
Infinite recursion in AcroForm::scanField in AcroForm.cc in xpdf 4.00allows attackers to launch denial of service via a specific pdf file due tolack of loop checking, as demonstrated by pdftohtml.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-7453` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

gir1.2-poppler-0.18 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-cpp0 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-glib8 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt4-4 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler-qt5-1 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
libpoppler58 - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
poppler-utils - 0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6
Available with Ubuntu Pro (Infra-only): https://ubuntu.com/pro

criterions.comment: xpdf package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and needs fixing.
poppler package in esm-infra/xenial, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '0.41.0-0ubuntu1.6').
ipe package in esm-apps/xenial is affected and may need fixing.
